history.content: 157AC is a high workload class, almost like a technical course. I can't judge on how useful/relevant it was to EECS given it is an ethics class and kinda applies generally in your life. But given that you already have 20 units, I think you'd be better off taking the R1A.

Earlier today I talked with my ESS advisor about my course schedule, and was discouraged from taking the class given my currently full (20 unit) course workload. It was mentioned that there are sections of the class not really relevant for EECS, and that if I choose the project option for the class (which I hope to do) that the amount of time spent on the class will skyrocket later on, which can be avoided by taking pretty much any other AC.

My questions are:

  • How applicable is E157AC for EECS? Would the project for the class be relevant for the major, or is it its own sorta thing?
  • What should I do this semester between E157AC and an R&C A, as a freshman? Would doing both along with CS 61A and Math 53 be doable?
history.subject: Relevancy of Engineering 157AC in EECS
